summary: This is a joint letter submission to Judge Nathan regarding redactions to the government's omnibus response and Exhibit 11 in the U.S. v. Maxwell case. It was sent by Nicole Simmons at the request of Laura Menninger.

persons.name: Nicole Simmons
persons.context: She is the sender of the email and appears to be a legal professional at Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C., submitting the joint letter to the court.

persons.name: Nathan
persons.context: Addressed as 'Judge Nathan', the recipient of the joint letter submission regarding redactions in the government's response.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: The joint letter submission is made at her request, indicating she is likely an attorney involved in the case.

connections.description: Nicole Simmons is acting at the request of Laura Menninger to submit the joint letter to the court.
Nicole Simmons is submitting a court filing to Judge Nathan.
Laura Menninger is involved in a case before Judge Nathan, as evidenced by the submission of a joint letter regarding redactions.

events.title: Court Order Issued
events.description: The Court issued an order (Dkt. No. 189) which the joint letter submission is pursuant to.

events.title: Joint Letter Submission
events.description: A joint letter regarding redactions to the government's omnibus response and Exhibit 11 is submitted to the court.

keyFacts: This document is a joint letter submission regarding redactions in the government's response in U.S. v. Maxwell, Case No. 20 Cr. 330 (AJN).
The submission is made pursuant to a court order dated March 29, 2021 (Dkt. No. 189).
The letter is sent by Nicole Simmons of Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C. at the request of Laura Menninger.
The document indicates ongoing legal proceedings and disputes over redactions in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
